alert.note: Alert for Osage (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 25 at 12:44AM CDT until October 25 at 5:45AM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central Kansas, including the following counties, Coffey, Lyon and Osage. * WHEN...Until 345 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1244 AM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1.5 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Osage City, Lebo, Neosho Rapids, Reading, Olivet and Melvern Lake. - This includes Interstate 35 between mile markers 136 and 152.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
